intro: Anthemis ammanthus, commonly known as the Egyptian tansy, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
